problem_text:
Let Vr be the class of all finite groups G satisfying a law [x, ry] = [x, sy] for some s = s(G) > r. Here [x, 1y] = [x, y] and [x, i+1y] = [[x, iy], y].
(a) Is there a function f such that every soluble group in Vr has Fitting length < f(r)? For r < 3 see (R. Brandl, Bull. Austral. Math. Soc., 28 (1983), 101–110).
(b) Is it true that Vr contains only finitely many nonabelian simple groups? This is true for r < 4.
R. Brandl
